inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: 60-15 mls/min as per the modified diet in renal disease

inclusion.criterion: Daytime systolic blood pressure on ambulatory monitor ≥ 135 mm Hg while taking 3 or more anti-hypertensives including a diuretic on maximal dose OR ambulatory monitor systolic blood pressure is <135 but taking 4 or more anti-hypertensives
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A minimum of 20 mm of length and 4 mm of diameter for renal arteries on CT renal angiogram or formal renal angiogram
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: not suitable for renal denervation based on the Indications for Use
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: 25-year-old G1 P1 pregnant woman with fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, urgency, frequency, and flank pain. Gram-negative rod-shaped bacterial cells in urine culture.
